s1.title: Flowscript
s1.p: Cocoon Flowscript is a JavaScript API to manage control flow based on an extended version of the Mozilla Rhino JavaScript interpreter that supports continuations.

s1.title: Flow Object Model
s1.p: Cocoon provides a set of system objects for use by Flowscripts. We call this set of objects the Flow Object Model (FOM). The Flow Object Model consists of the following objects:

s2.title: Cocoon Object
s2.p: The Cocoon object represents the current Cocoon Sitemap. This is the entry point into the FOM. There is one instance of Cocoon which you may access in your scripts as the global variable cocoon, for example like this:
The Cocoon object supports the following properties and functions:

s3.title: request
s3.p: The current Cocoon request:
Property [Request] request

s3.title: response
s3.p: The current Cocoon response:
Property [Response] response

s3.title: session
s3.p: The current Cocoon session:
Property [Session] session

s3.title: context
s3.p: The current Cocoon application context:
Property [Context] context

s3.title: log
s3.p: A reference to the current logger:
Property [Log] log

s3.title: parameters
s3.p: Any parameters passed to the script by the Cocoon Sitemap

s3.title: sendPage
s3.p: Passes control to the Cocoon sitemap to generate the output page.

uri is the sitemap URI of the page to be sent back to the client. If the URI starts with a slash, it is resolved starting at the root sitemap, otherwise it is resolved relative to the current sitemap. The URI should not contain a scheme (such as cocoon:).
bean is a context object which can be accessed inside this page to extract various values and place them in the generated page.

s3.title: sendPageAndWait
s3.p: Passes control to the Cocoon sitemap to generate the output page.
The flow script is suspended after the page is generated and the whole execution stack saved in the WebContinuation object returned from this function.

uri is the relative URL of the page to be sent back to the client. If the URI starts with a slash, it is resolved starting at the root sitemap, otherwise it is resolved relative to the current sitemap. The URI should not contain a scheme (such as cocoon:).
bean is a context object which can be accessed inside this page to extract various values and place them in the generated page.

If provided, the postPipelineCode function will be executed after pipeline processing is complete but before the script is suspended. You can use this to release resources that are needed during the pipeline processing but should not become part of the continuation. For example:
timeToLive is the time to live in milliseconds for the continuation created.
The return value is the continuation object.

s3.title: sendStatus
s3.p: Sends an empty response with the provided HTTP status code.

s3.title: createPageLocal
s3.p: Creates a Page Local object. The returned object behaves like a normal JavaScript object, but restores the property values it had when sendPageAndWait was originally called, each time a page is resubmitted (e.g. after hitting the back button). Such objects can be used to associate state with one particular page sent to the browser.

s3.title: processPipelineTo
s3.p: Call the Cocoon sitemap for the given URI, sending the output of the eventually matched pipeline to the specified OutputStream.

uri is the URI for which the request should be generated. If the URI starts with a slash, it is resolved starting at the root sitemap, otherwise it is resolved relative to the current sitemap. The URI should not contain a scheme (such as cocoon:).
bizData is the business data object to be made available to the forwarded pipeline
stream is an OutputStream where the output should be written to.

s3.title: redirectTo
s3.p: Send a client-side redirect to the browser. The uri argument is the URI to which the browser should be redirected.

s3.title: createWebContinuation
s3.p: Creates a new "bookmark" WebContinuation object. When invoked it will cause the script to resume right after the call. By calling this function prior to sendPageAndWait() you can be create a "bookmark" which will cause the page to be redisplayed in the browser. Note: the WebContinuation associated with sendPageAndWait() doesn't do this. Rather it resumes execution after the the page is submitted.
For example:

s3.title: load
s3.p: Load the JavaScript script specified by uri. The Cocoon source resolver is used to resolve uri.

s3.title: getComponent
s3.p: Access an Avalon component.

s3.title: releaseComponent
s3.p: Release a pooled Avalon component.

s3.title: createObject
s3.p: Create and setup an object so that it can access the information provided to regular components. This is done by calling the various Avalon lifecycle interfaces implemented by the object.

s3.title: disposeObject
s3.p: Dispose an object that has been created using createObject.

s2.title: Request Object
s2.p: The Request object represents the current Cocoon request. It provides the following functions and properties:

s3.title: get
s3.p: Get the request parameter or attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: getAttribute
s3.p: Get the request attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: getAttributeNames
s3.p: Get an enumeration of request attribute names.

s3.title: setAttribute
s3.p: Set the value of a request attribute.

s3.title: removeAttribute
s3.p: Remove the attribute with the name name from this request.

s3.title: getCharacterEncoding
s3.p: Return the character encoding used by this request.

s3.title: setCharacterEncoding
s3.p: Set the character encoding used by this request.

s3.title: getContentLength
s3.p: Get the content-length of this request

s3.title: getContentType
s3.p: Get the content-type of this request

s3.title: getParameter
s3.p: Get the request parameter with the specified name.

s3.title: getParameterValues
s3.p: Get an array of request parameters with the specified name.

s3.title: getParameterNames
s3.p: Get an enumeration of the parameter names in this request.

s3.title: getAuthType
s3.p: Get the authorization type used in this request.

s3.title: getProtocol
s3.p: Get the protocol used in this request.

s3.title: getScheme
s3.p: Get the scheme used in this request.

s3.title: getMethod
s3.p: Get the method used in this request.

s3.title: getServerName
s3.p: Get the server name of this request.

s3.title: getServerPort
s3.p: Get the server port of this request.

s3.title: getRemoteAddr
s3.p: Get the remote address of this request.

s3.title: isSecure
s3.p: Get the secure property of this request.

s3.title: getLocale
s3.p: Get the locale of this request.

s3.title: getLocales
s3.p: Get the locales of this request.

s3.title: getCookies
s3.p: Get the cookies associated with this request.

s3.title: getHeader
s3.p: Get the header with name from this request.

s3.title: getHeaders
s3.p: Get the headers associated with this request.

s3.title: getHeaderNames
s3.p: Get an enumeration of header names from this request.

s3.title: getRemoteUser
s3.p: Get the remote user associated with this request.

s3.title: getUserPrincipal
s3.p: Get the user principal associated with this request.

s3.title: isUserInRole
s3.p: Returns whether the user associated with this request is in the specified role.

s3.title: Properties
s3.p: Request properties map to request parameters, i.e. request.blah is equivalent to request.getParameter("blah").

s2.title: Response Object
s2.p: The Response object represents the Cocoon response associated with the current request.

The response object contains hooks only to the cookies and to the response headers. Everything else will be controlled by the rest of the cocoon pipeline machinery (like output encoding, for example, which should *NOT* be determined by the flow).
It provides the following functions and properties:

s3.title: createCookie
s3.p: Creates a new Cookie.

s3.title: addCookie
s3.p: Adds cookie to the current response.

s3.title: containsHeader
s3.p: Returns whether the current response contains a header with the specified name.

s3.title: setHeader
s3.p: Replaces the value of the header with name with value.

s3.title: addHeader
s3.p: Creates a new header in the current response with the specified name and value.

s3.title: setStatus
s3.p: Sets the status code for this response.

s2.title: Session Object
s2.p: The Session object represents the user session associated with the current Cocoon request.
It provides the following functions and properties:

s3.title: getAttribute
s3.p: Get the value of the session attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: setAttribute
s3.p: Set the value of the session attribute with the specified name to value.

s3.title: removeAttribute
s3.p: Remove the session attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: invalidate
s3.p: Invalidate this session, releasing all resources associated with it.

s3.title: isNew
s3.p: Returns true if the client does not yet know about the session or if the client chooses not to join the session. For example, if the server used only cookie-based sessions, and the client had disabled the use of cookies, then a session would be new on each request.

s3.title: getId
s3.p: Returns the unique id associated with this session.

s3.title: getCreationTime
s3.p: Returns the time when this session was created, measured in milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

s3.title: getLastAccessedTime
s3.p: Returns the last time the client sent a request associated with this session, as the number of milliseconds since midnight January 1, 1970 GMT.

s3.title: setMaxInactiveInterval
s3.p: Specifies the time, in seconds, between client requests before the contextcontainer will invalidate this session. A negative time indicates the session should never timeout.

s3.title: getMaxInactiveInterval
s3.p: Returns the maximum time interval, in seconds, that the context container will keep this session open between client accesses. After this interval, the context container will invalidate the session. The maximum time interval can be set with the setMaxInactiveInterval method. A negative time indicates the session should never timeout.

s3.title: Properties
s3.p: Session properties map to session attributes, i.e. session.blah is equivalent to session.getAttribute("blah").

s2.title: Context Object
s2.p: The Context object represents the client context associated with the current Cocoon request.
It provides the following functions and properties:

s3.title: getAttribute
s3.p: Get the value of the context attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: setAttribute
s3.p: Set the value of the context attribute with the specified name to value.

s3.title: removeAttribute
s3.p: Remove the context attribute with the specified name.

s3.title: getInitParameter
s3.p: Get the value of the context initialization parameter with the specified name.

s3.title: Properties
s3.p: Context properties map to context attributes, i.e. context.blah is equivalent to context.getAttribute("blah").

s2.title: Cookie Object
s2.p: Cookie provides the following functions and properties:

s3.title: getName
s3.p: Get the name of this cookie.

s3.title: getVersion
s3.p: Get the version of this cookie.

s3.title: setVersion
s3.p: Set the version of this cookie.

s3.title: getValue
s3.p: Get the value of this cookie.

s3.title: setValue
s3.p: Set the value of this cookie.

s3.title: getComment
s3.p: Get the comment of this cookie.

s3.title: setComment
s3.p: Set the comment of this cookie.

s3.title: getDomain
s3.p: Get the domain of this cookie.

s3.title: setDomain
s3.p: Set the domain of this cookie.

s3.title: getPath
s3.p: Get the path of this cookie.

s3.title: setPath
s3.p: Set the path of this cookie.

s3.title: getSecure
s3.p: Get the secure property of this cookie.

s3.title: setSecure
s3.p: Set the secure property of this cookie.

s2.title: Log Object
s2.p: The Log object provides an interface to the Cocoon logging system.

s3.title: error
s3.p: Log an error message. If exception is provided its stack trace will also be logged.

s3.title: debug
s3.p: Log a debug message. If exception is provided its stack trace will also be logged.

s3.title: warn
s3.p: Log a warning message. If exception is provided its stack trace will also be logged.

s3.title: info
s3.p: Log an information message. If exception is provided its stack trace will also be logged.

s3.title: isErrorEnabled
s3.p: Returns whether error message logging is enabled.

s3.title: isDebugEnabled
s3.p: Returns whether debug message logging is enabled.

s3.title: isWarnEnabled
s3.p: Returns whether warning message logging is enabled.

s3.title: isInfoEnabled
s3.p: Returns whether information message logging is enabled.

s2.title: WebContinuation
s2.p: A WebContinuation represents a continuation of a Flowscript. Because a user may click on the back button in the browser and restart a saved computation in a continuation, each WebContinuation becomes the parent of a subtree of continuations.
If there is no parent WebContinuation, the created continuation becomes the root of a tree of WebContinuations.
WebContinuation objects support the following functions and properties:

s3.title: id
s3.p: Returns the unique string identifier of this Web Continuation.

s3.title: continuation
s3.p: Returns the JavaScript continuation associated with this Web Continuation.

s3.title: previousBookmark
s3.p: Returns a reference to the first bookmark continuation among the pages preceding the one associated with this object, or null if no such bookmark continuation exists. The returned object is the continuation you would invoke to implement a "Back" button.

s3.title: isBookmark
s3.p: Returns true if this continuation was not created by sendPageAndWait.

s3.title: getParent
s3.p: Get the parent continuation of this continuation.

s3.title: getChildren
s3.p: Get the child continuations of this continuation.

s3.title: invalidate
s3.p: Invalidates a WebContinuation. This effectively means that the continuation object associated with it will no longer be accessible from Web pages. Invalidating a WebContinuation invalidates all the WebContinuations which are children of it.
